page.title: 09A75 EuroRoute-Castle Kennedy
page.content:
-The A75 is the main road linking Northern Ireland with the rest of Britain.Traffic from Southern Ireland also uses it.Juggernauts,lorries and cars cross from Larne to Stranraer and Cairnryan. { { The stretch of the A75 within this {section is straight and fast and {within the period from 1979 to 1985 {there have been fourteen traffic {accidents resulting in eight {fatalities.}
The Castle Kennedy Community Council have campaigned for a footpath from the village to the Eynhallow Hotel as this is the part most used by pedestrians. In 1985 it was agreed that a lit footpath was needed and hopefully work will begin on this in the near future.
